Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Sitter \Sit"ter\, n. 1. One who sits; esp., one who sits for a portrait or a bust. [1913 Webster]
2. A bird that sits or incubates. [1913 Webster]

Sitter n 1: Dutch astronomer who calculated the size of the universe and suggested that it is expanding (1872-1934) [syn: {Willem de Sitter}] 2: an organism (person or animal) that sits [ant: {stander}] 3: a person engaged to care for children when the parents are not home [syn: {babysitter}, {baby-sitter}] 4: a person who poses for a painter or sculptor [syn: {artist's model}] 5: a domestic hen ready to brood [syn: {brood hen}, {broody}, {broody hen}, {setting hen}]
